Officers covered Daniel Prude’s head with a “spit hood.” His death brought new scrutiny of the devices.

Wall Street Has Its Worst Day in MonthsThe S&P 500 dropped 3.5 percent on Thursday, the biggest single-day fall since June 11, as big tech companies weighed on it heavily.
Unemployment Claims Show Layoffs Continue to Batter EconomyProgress in restoring lost jobs has become more challenging. “It’s pretty bad at this stage in the crisis,” one economist said.
Facebook Moves to Limit Election Chaos in NovemberThe move to bar new political ads in late October is an acknowledgment of the platform’s power, but critics called it too little and too late.
President Trump created a new headache for election officials by encouraging people to vote twice, which is illegal.

This Is What America Looks Like at Hunger’s EdgeIn the pandemic economy, nearly one in eight households doesn’t have enough to eat. The lockdown has revealed a struggle that was hidden in plain sight.
“I’m in love with that boat,” Ms. Quinn said, sighing. Tristan Spinski for The New York Times
